item.title: Problem with LeetCode and SWE jobs
item.description: This is a rant about software engineering interviews and LeetCode. üóØÔ∏è Preamble In 2024, hundreds of thousands of people worldwide are grinding through LeetCode, aiming to break into the tech industry, drawn by the high salaries it offers. ü§î What does LeetCode actually bring? LeetCode offers little more than these benefits: Algorithm exercises and data structure knowledge Coding under pressure (Why though? Are we in a war zone now?) Passing coding interviews However, completing LeetCode doesn’t prove you’re a good software engineer.

item.title: Being 10x engineer in my first job
item.description: Recently, I came across a post on LinkedIn with the eye-catching title, ‚ÄúI think I‚Äôve met a 10x engineer.‚Äù But as I read through the post, I started to have doubts. The author described how one of their colleagues had managed to fix a bunch of complex bugs in a short amount of time, which left them in awe. ü§î But is that really what defines a 10x engineer? It brought back memories of my own experience as a so-called 10x engineer during my first job!
